p: The epidemics in eastern Africa and the Horn of Africa involve a 5–15 year cycle marked by abnormally high rainfall, e.g. during the warm phase of the El Niño/Southern Oscillation phenomenon (ENSO) [ 10, 11]. In other regions of Africa, the occurrence of the disease is linked to other sources of flooding, e.g. the construction of a hydroelectric dam along the Senegal river [ 12, 13].
